4. Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your shoulder muscles, and then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.

5. Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form and control throughout the exercise.

Remember to choose an appropriate weight that challenges you without compromising proper form.

Name: Dumbbell Shrug
Description:
1. Begin by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand, holding them at arm's length by your sides.

2. Keeping your arms straight and elbows slightly bent, lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible. Hold for a brief pause at the top of the movement.

3. Slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position, ensuring that you maintain control throughout the movement.

4. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

Name: Dumbbell Side Bend
Description:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.

2. Keeping your back straight, slowly tilt your upper body towards the side that is not holding the dumbbell.

3. Lower the dumbbell towards your knee as you continue to lean to the side, feeling a stretch in your oblique muscles.

4. Hold the stretch for a brief moment and then slowly return to the starting position.

5. Repeat the exercise on the opposite side, holding the dumbbell in the other hand.

Name: Dumbbell Single Leg Split Squat
Description:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.

2. Lift one foot off the ground and extend it forward, keeping it slightly off the floor.

3. Lower your body down into a squat position by bending your standing leg, while simultaneously keeping your torso upright and the dumbbells by your sides for balance.

4. Continue lowering your body until your thigh is parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go without compromising your form.

5. Push through your standing heel to return to the starting position, with your lifted foot still off the ground.

6. Repeat the exercise with the opposite leg, alternating legs for each repetition.

Name: Dumbbell Squat
Description:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.

2. Keeping your chest up and your back straight, engage your core and begin to lower your body down into a squat position by bending at your knees and hips.

3. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go while maintaining proper form.

4. Pause for a brief moment at the bottom of the squat, then exhale and push through your heels to return to the starting position.

5. Ensure that you maintain control throughout the entire movement and keep your knees aligned with your toes.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Alternate Raise
Synergist: Deltoid Lateral, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Serratus Anterior
Description:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides, palms facing inwards.

2. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles for stability.

3. Lift one dumbbell out to the side of your body, while keeping a slight bend in your elbow. Raise the dumbbell until it reaches shoulder level, ensuring that the movement is controlled.

4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder muscles.

5. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner, and repeat the same movement with the other arm.

6. Continue alternating between arms, raising and lowering the dumbbells in a controlled manner for the desired number of repetitions.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Biceps Curl
Description:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing forward.

2. Keep your elbows close to your torso and slowly exhale as you lift the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, while contracting your biceps.

3. As you lift the dumbbells, make sure to keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms.

4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, ensuring that you feel a strong contraction in your biceps.

5. Inhale as you slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, while maintaining control and keeping your elbows close to your torso.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form throughout the movement.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise
Description:
1. Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms hanging down by your sides.

2. Lift your heels off the floor while keeping your toes firmly planted on the ground, using the support provided by the balls of your feet.

3. Rise up on your tiptoes as high as possible, while fully contracting your calf muscles. Hold this position for a brief moment.

4. Slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position, allowing your calf muscles to fully stretch.

5. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control and focus on engaging your calf muscles throughout the exercise.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Concentration Curl
Description:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in one hand.

2. Place your opposite hand on your thigh for support and stability.

3. Gradually raise the dumbbell towards your chest while keeping your elbow close to your side. This is your starting position.

4. Exhale as you curl the dumbbell upwards, focusing on contracting your biceps and keeping your upper arm stationary.

5. Pause for a brief moment at the top of the movement, and then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position while inhaling.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Kickback
Description:
1. Begin by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.

2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at your waist, maintaining a straight back and engaging your core.

3. Keeping your upper arms close to your body, extend both dumbbells back behind you by straightening your elbows. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, keeping control and tension in your triceps throughout the exercise.

5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring that you maintain proper form and control throughout.

Name: Dumbbell Standing One Arm Concentration Curl
Description:
1. Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand, letting it hang between your legs.

2. Place the back of your upper arm against the inside of your thigh, just above your knee, ensuring that your arm is fully extended and your palm is facing up.

3. Keeping your upper arm stationary, exhale and curl the weight upward, contracting your bicep muscles. Continue to curl until your dumbbell reaches shoulder level.

4. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment, squeezing your bicep.

5. In a controlled manner, inhale and slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.

Name: Dumbbell Standing One Arm Extension
Description:
1. Begin by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand, palm facing inward towards your body.

2. Keeping your elbow close to your side and your upper arm stationary, slowly extend your forearm backward, straightening your arm fully.

3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, ensuring that your arm is fully extended and your triceps muscles are engaged.

4. Slowly return your forearm to the starting position, bending at the elbow and maintaining control throughout the movement.

5. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other arm.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Palms In Press
Synergist: Deltoid Lateral, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Serratus Anterior, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.

2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and rest them at shoulder height with your palms facing inward towards each other.

3. Take a deep breath in, brace your core, and exhale as you press the dumbbells overhead.

4. Fully extend your arms overhead, making sure to keep your palms facing each other throughout the motion.

5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, keeping your palms facing inward.

Name: Dumbbell Standing Triceps Extension
Description:
1. Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in both hands, palms facing inwards towards your body.

2. Lift the dumbbell straight up overhead by extending your arms fully. Make sure to keep your elbows close to your ears throughout the movement.

3. Once your arms are fully extended, lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms.

4. Continue lowering the dumbbell until you feel a stretch in your triceps muscles. Maintain control and avoid dropping the dumbbell too quickly.

5. Pause for a moment in the stretched position, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position by extending your arms fully.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and control throughout the movement.

Remember to start with a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and gradually increase the weight as you become stronger. Good luck with your workout!

Name: Dumbbell Step-up
Description:
1. Place a dumbbell in each hand and stand facing a step or platform.

2. Step onto the platform with your right foot, ensuring that your entire foot is firmly planted on it.

3. Push through your right heel and elevate your body onto the platform, while simultaneously bringing your left knee up towards your chest.

4. Lower your left foot back down to the starting position on the ground, while keeping your right foot on the platform.

5. Carefully step your right foot back down to the ground, ensuring that your entire foot is firmly planted and stable.

6. Repeat the exercise, this time starting with your left foot and alternating between your right and left foot for each repetition.

Name: Dumbbell Stiff Leg Deadlift
Description:
1. Place a pair of dumbbells on the floor in front of you, hip-width apart.

2. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and a slight bend at the hips.

3. Hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back flat and core engaged as you lower the dumbbells towards your feet. Your legs should remain straight but not locked.

4. Lower the dumbbells until you feel a stretch in the back of your legs (hamstrings) while maintaining a neutral spine and keeping the dumbbells close to your body.

5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then engage your hamstrings and glutes as you stand back up by squeezing your buttocks and pushing through your heels.

Name: Dumbbell Straight Arm Pullover
Synergist: Deltoid Posterior, Latissimus Dorsi, Levator Scapulae, Teres Major, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Lie down on a flat exercise bench with your feet flat on the ground and a dumbbell in both hands.

2. Extend your arms straight above your chest, holding the dumbbell with both hands and keeping a slight bend in your elbows.

3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lower the dumbbell backward over your head towards the floor, maintaining control throughout the movement.

4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your chest and shoulders, making sure not to go any further to avoid straining your muscles.

5. Slowly reverse the movement, bringing the dumbbell back to the starting position above your chest, engaging your chest and shoulder muscles.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and control throughout the movement.

Name: Dumbbell Upright Row
Synergist: Biceps Brachii, Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Anterior, Infraspinatus, Serratus Anterior, Teres Minor, Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Description:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body.

2. Start by keeping your arms straight and letting the dumbbells hang in front of your thighs.

3. Begin the movement by raising both dumbbells towards your chin, keeping them close to your body. Your elbows should be higher than your forearms throughout the exercise.

4. As you lift the dumbbells, exhale and keep your shoulders relaxed, focusing on engaging your upper back muscles.

5. Pause for a brief moment at the top of the movement, with the dumbbells just below your chin.

6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, ensuring that your arms remain straight throughout the descent. 

Remember to maintain proper form, engage your core muscles, and perform the exercise with controlled movements.

Name: Dumbbell Zottman Curl
Description:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inward towards your body.

2. Begin the exercise by curling the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, while keeping your elbows close to your body and your upper arms stationary.

3. Once you have reached the top of the curl, rotate your wrists so that your palms are now facing upwards.

4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, again keeping your elbows close to your body and your upper arms still.

5. As you reach the bottom of the curl, rotate your wrists back so that your palms are facing inward towards your body again.

6. Repeat these steps for the desired number of repetitions, alternating between palms facing inward and palms facing upwards during each curl.

Keep in mind that for optimal results and safety, it is always recommended to consult with a fitness professional or trainer before starting any new exercise routine.

Name: Elbow-To-Knee
Description:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your legs extended and arms by your sides.

2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly off the ground, engaging your core muscles.

3. Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest while simultaneously lifting your left shoulder off the ground.

4. As you bring your knee towards your chest, twist your torso and aim to touch your left elbow to your right knee.

5. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat the same movement, but this time with your left knee towards your chest and your right shoulder lifted.

6. Continue alternating sides, bringing your knees towards your chest and touching the opposite elbow to knee in a controlled manner.

Name: EZ Barbell Close-grip Curl
Description:
1. Grab an EZ barbell with an underhand grip that is slightly narrower than shoulder width apart. Your palms should be facing upward and your elbows close to your torso.

2. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Make sure your core is engaged, and your back is straight.

3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale as you begin to curl the barbell upwards. Focus on using just your forearms and biceps to perform the movement.

4. Continue the curl until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level. Hold the position for a brief pause while squeezing your biceps.

5. Inhale as you slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, ensuring you maintain control throughout the movement.



Remember to always use proper form and start with a weight that is suitable for your fitness level.

Name: EZ Barbell Curl
Description:
1. Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the EZ barbell using an underhand grip (palms facing upward). Your hands should be slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on the barbell.

2. Keep your elbows close to your body and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, focusing on contracting your biceps. Exhale during this upward movement.

3. Continue to curl the barbell until your forearms are almost touching your biceps. You should feel a strong contraction in your biceps at this point.

4. Hold the contraction for a brief moment, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position. Inhale during this downward movement.

5. Make sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and avoiding any swinging or jerking motions. Remember to engage your core for stability.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on controlled movements and maintaining tension in your biceps throughout each repetition.

Note: It is always recommended to consult with a fitness professional or trainer before starting any new exercise program to ensure proper form and technique.

Name: EZ Barbell Incline Triceps Extension
Description:
1. Start by positioning yourself on an incline bench with the EZ barbell in your hands, using an overhand grip.

2. Ensure that your upper arms are perpendicular to the floor and pointed towards the ceiling, while keeping your elbows close to your body.

3. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows, maintaining control and avoiding any jerking motions.

4. Once the barbell is near or lightly touches your forehead, extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting your triceps.

5. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back pressed against the bench throughout the entire movement.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form and range of motion to effectively work your triceps.

Name: EZ Barbell Reverse Grip Curl
Description:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp an EZ barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing up).

2. Relax your shoulders and allow your arms to fully extend down in front of your body.

3. Keeping your upper arms still, exhale and curl the barbell towards your shoulders by flexing your forearms.

4. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position while inhaling.

Note: Make sure to keep your elbows close to your sides and avoid swinging your body or using momentum to lift the barbell. Focus on engaging your biceps to perform the movement effectively.

Example full instruction: "Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the EZ barbell with an underhand grip. Relax your shoulders and let your arms fully extend in front of your body. Curl the barbell towards your shoulders by flexing your forearms. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position. Remember to keep your elbows close to your body and avoid using momentum."

Name: EZ Barbell Reverse grip Preacher Curl
Description:
1. Sit down on a preacher curl bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground.

2. Grasp the EZ barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing upward), placing your hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.

3. Rest your upper arms on the angled pad of the preacher curl bench, ensuring that your triceps are fully extended and your chest is pressed against the pad.

4. Slowly begin to curl the barbell towards your shoulders, focusing on contracting your biceps muscles. Keep your elbows stationary and your upper arms pressed against the pad throughout the movement.

5. Continue curling until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level. Pause for a moment to squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.

6. With control, slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms and stretching your biceps.

Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, avoid swinging your body for momentum, and breathe steadily.

Name: EZ Barbell Seated Triceps Extension
Description:
1. Sit on a flat bench and hold the EZ barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.

2. Lift the barbell above your head, arms fully extended, and elbows pointing forward.

3. Keeping your upper arms close to your head and stationary, slowly lower the barbell down behind your head by bending your elbows.

4. Exhale as you extend your arms and bring the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

5. Pause briefly in the starting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Name: Finger Curls
Description:
1. Start by sitting in a comfortable position with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.

2. Place your hands on a flat surface, such as a table, with your fingers spread out and pointing forward.

3. Begin the exercise by slowly curling your fingers towards your palm, one at a time, starting with your pinky finger and moving towards your thumb.

4. As you curl each finger, focus on squeezing the muscles in your hand and keeping the movement controlled and steady.

5. Once you have curled all your fingers, hold the contracted position for a few seconds to fully engage the muscles.

6. Slowly release your fingers back to the starting position, extending them one at a time, starting with your thumb and moving towards your pinky finger.
Remember to maintain smooth and controlled movements throughout the exercise.

Name: Flutter Kicks
Description:
1. Lie flat on your back on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat or exercise mat.

2. Extend your legs fully, keeping them close together and straight.

3. Place your hands either under your glutes or by your sides, palms facing down for additional support.

4. Engage your core muscles by pressing your lower back into the ground and lifting your shoulder blades slightly off the mat.

5. Begin the exercise by lifting your legs off the ground a few inches. Maintain a slight bend in your knees.

6. Alternate lifting each leg slightly higher than the other in a fluttering motion. Keep your legs straight and avoid bending at the knees. Focus on using your lower abdominal muscles to drive the movement.

7. Continue fluttering your legs for the desired duration or number of repetitions as instructed by your workout routine.

Name: Front Plank
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Gluteus Maximus, Gluteus Medius, Obliques, Sartorius, Tensor Fasciae Latae
Description:
1. Start by lying facedown on the mat or floor, with your forearms placed flat on the ground directly underneath your shoulders. Keep your palms facing down.

2. Lift your body off the ground, supporting your weight with your forearms and toes. Your body should form a straight line from head to toe, parallel to the ground. Engage your core muscles to maintain stability.

3. Position your elbows directly beneath your shoulders, ensuring they are shoulder-width apart. Your arms should be parallel to each other.

4. Hold this position for the desired amount of time, aiming for at least 20-30 seconds to begin with. As you progress, you can gradually increase the duration.

5. Maintain a neutral neck position by looking down at the ground or slightly forward, avoiding any strain on the neck.

6. Focus on breathing deeply and steadily throughout the exercise, while keeping your core muscles engaged to maximize the benefits of the front plank.

Name: Hanging Straight Leg Hip Raise
Synergist: Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus, Iliopsoas, Obliques, Quadriceps, Sartorius
Description:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar using a pronated grip (palms facing away from your body).

2. Keep your legs straight and raise them up by contracting your abdominal muscles. Your body should form a "L" shape.

3. Lower your legs back down to the starting position with control, keeping your core engaged throughout.

4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and controlled movements.

Name: Hanging Straight Twisting Leg Hip Raise
Description:
1. Begin by hanging from a pull-up bar with your body fully extended and your feet off the ground.

2. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.

3. Slowly raise your straight legs up towards the bar while maintaining a slight bend in your elbows.

4. As you reach the top of the movement, twist your hips to one side, bringing your legs towards that side.

5. Lower your legs back down with control, and then repeat the movement by twisting your hips to the opposite side.

6. Continue alternating sides with each repetition.

Remember, it's important to focus on maintaining control and proper form throughout the exercise. Good luck and enjoy your workout!

Name: Hip Raise (bent knee)
Synergist: Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus, Obliques, Pectineous, Sartorius, Tensor Fasciae Latae
Description:
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.

2. Place your arms relaxed by your sides, palms facing down.

3. Engage your core and glutes by squeezing them tightly.

4. Raise your hips off the ground by pushing through your heels, maintaining a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.

5. Pause for a second at the top, squeezing your glutes, and then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

6. Repeat the exercise according to your desired repetitions.

You got this! Remember to keep your core and glutes engaged throughout the movement for maximum effectiveness. Well done!

Name: Hyperextension (on bench)
Description:
1. Lie face down on a hyperextension bench, with your hips resting on the pad and your feet securely anchored under the footpads.

2. Cross your hands over your chest or place them behind your head, whichever is more comfortable.

3. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your upper body off the bench, making sure to keep your back straight and aligned with your neck and hips.

4. Continue lifting until your body forms a straight line from your hips to your head, making sure not to hyperextend your lower back.

5. Hold this position for a brief moment, and then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.

Name: Hyperextension
Description:
1. Lie face down on the hyperextension bench with your hips resting comfortably on the cushion and your feet securely locked underneath the footpads.

2. Cross your arms over your chest or place them behind your head, whichever is more comfortable for you.

3. Keeping your lower body steady, slowly lift your upper body off the bench until you reach a position where your body is in a straight line. This will engage the muscles in your lower back and glutes.

4. Hold this position for a moment, making sure to maintain good form and control throughout the movement.

5. Lower your upper body back down to the starting position in a controlled manner, without letting your body drop or sway.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on engaging the targeted muscles and maintaining proper form throughout.

Name: Incline Leg Hip Raise (leg straight)
Synergist: Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus, Obliques, Pectineous, Quadriceps, Sartorius, Tensor Fasciae Latae
Description:
1. Lie down on an incline bench with your back supported and heels resting on the edge of the bench.

2. Extend your legs straight out in front of you, keeping them close together.

3. Place your hands alongside your body or grip the bench for stability.

4. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your legs upward, maintaining a straight line from your feet to your hips.

5. Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your glutes and engaging your hip flexors.

6. Lower your legs back down to the starting position with control, but do not let them touch the bench.

Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, avoid arching your back, and focus on using your abdominal and hip muscles to perform the movement.

Name: Incline Reverse Grip Push-Up
Synergist: Biceps Brachii, Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head
Description:
1. Find an inclined surface such as a bench or step and position yourself facing downwards with your hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing up and fingers pointing towards your feet.

2. Make sure your body is straight from head to toe, with your feet together and resting on your toes.

3. Lower your body towards the inclined surface by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.

4. Continue to lower your chest until it is close to the surface, while maintaining a controlled movement and keeping your core engaged.

5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, and then exhale as you push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms again.

6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, and remember to keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise, avoiding any arching or bending at the hips.

Name: Incline Twisting Sit-up
Synergist: Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus, Pectineous, Quadriceps, Rectus Abdominis, Sartorius
Description:
1. Lie down on an incline bench with your feet secured under the padded holders.

2. Cross your arms over your chest or place them behind your head, whichever is more comfortable.

3. Engage your core muscles and exhale as you slowly lift your upper body off the bench, using your abs to initiate the movement.

4. As you lift up, twist your torso to one side while keeping your lower body stable. Hold for a second and then return to the starting position.

5. Repeat the twisting motion, this time twisting to the opposite side, while maintaining control and using your abs to power the movement.

6. Continue alternating twists from side to side, focusing on keeping your core engaged and your movements controlled.

Name: Inverted Row
Target: Infraspinatus, Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Teres Minor , Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Start by setting up a suspension trainer or a bar approximately waist height from the ground.

2. Stand facing the bar and grab it with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

3. Lean back, keeping your body straight, until your arms are fully extended and you are hanging at an angle with your feet still touching the ground.

4. Engage your core and pull your chest up towards the bar, leading with your shoulder blades and squeezing your back muscles.

5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, making sure to keep your body in a straight line.

6. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

Name: Jackknife Sit-Up
Synergist: Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus, Obliques, Pectineous, Quadriceps, Sartorius, Tensor Fasciae Latae
Description:
1. Lie flat on your back on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat or exercise mat.

2. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart.

3. Place your hands behind your head, interlacing your fingers gently.

4. Slowly curl your torso upwards, using your abs to lift your shoulders off the ground while keeping your lower back and feet on the floor.

5. Continue to raise your upper body until you are sitting upright, making sure to exhale as you crunch forward.

6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.

Name: Lever Single Arm Neutral Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
Target: Infraspinatus, Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Teres Minor , Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Sit down on the machine with your feet securely placed on the footrest, ensuring that your back is straight and your knees are slightly bent.

2. Grasp the neutral grip handlebar with only one hand, with your palm facing your body and your arm fully extended.

3. Engage your core and pull the handlebar towards your body, keeping your elbow close to your side and squeezing your shoulder blade.

4. Pause for a moment when the handlebar reaches your midsection, maintaining tension in your back muscles.

5. Slowly release the handlebar back to the starting position, ensuring that your arm is fully extended and your shoulder is not hunched forward.

6. Repeat the exercise with the other arm while maintaining proper form and control throughout the movement.

Remember to adjust the weight on the machine according to your level of strength and gradually increase it as you become more comfortable with the exercise.

Name: Lever Bicep Curl
Description:
1. Sit on a bench or chair with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.

2. Hold a dumbbell or barbell in each hand, palms facing up, and rest your upper arms on the lever pads of a bicep curl machine.

3. Initiate the movement by flexing your elbows, bringing the lever pads towards your shoulders while keeping your upper arms stationary.

4. Contract your biceps at the top of the movement, squeezing for a brief moment.

5. Slowly lower the lever pads back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions to target your bicep muscles effectively.

Name: Lever Chest Press (plate loaded)
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Begin by setting the desired weight load on the machine's weight stack.

2. Sit on the seat of the lever chest press machine with your back pressed firmly against the backrest and your feet firmly on the ground.

3. Place your hands on the handles of the machine, ensuring a comfortable and secure grip.

4. Inhale deeply and, as you exhale, push the handles forward by extending your arms fully, making sure to engage your chest muscles.

5. Pause for a brief moment at the fully extended position, being careful not to lock out your elbows.

6. Slowly reverse the movement by inhaling and bringing the handles back towards your body, allowing your chest muscles to relax and gradually return to the starting position.

Name: Lever Chest Press
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Sit on the chest press machine with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back resting against the backrest.

2. Grasp the handles of the machine, placing your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

3. Push the handles forward and away from your body, extending your arms fully. Keep your elbows slightly bent to prevent locking.

4. Slowly bring the handles back towards your body, controlling the movement and keeping your core engaged.

5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form throughout.

Name: Lever Deadlift (plate loaded)
Description:
1. Approach the lever deadlift machine and position yourself directly in front of it.

2. Adjust the height of the platform so that it aligns with your mid-shin level. This will allow for proper starting position and range of motion.

3. Step onto the platform, standing shoulder-width apart with your feet firmly planted on the ground.

4. Bend at the hips and knees, grasping the handles of the lever deadlift machine. Ensure that your grip is secure and comfortable.

5. Extend your legs and hips, driving through your feet to lift the lever deadlift machine off the platform. Keep your back straight and engage your core throughout the movement.

6. Once you have fully extended your hips and knees, pause briefly at the top before slowly lowering the machine back down to the starting position.

Remember to maintain proper form and technique throughout the exercise to prevent injury and maximize the benefits.

Name: Lever Front Pulldown
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Infraspinatus, Teres Major, Teres Minor, Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Description:
1. Sit comfortably on the lever front pulldown machine with your feet flat on the ground and knees bent at a 90-degree angle.

2. Grasp the wide bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

3. Keeping your back straight and your chest lifted, exhale as you pull the bar down towards your upper chest or the midpoint between your upper chest and collarbone.

4. Pause for a moment when the bar is at its lowest point, and squeeze your shoulder blades together.

5. Inhale as you slowly release the bar back to the starting position, extending your arms fully.

Remember to adjust the weight on the machine according to your fitness level and to consult with a professional trainer to ensure proper form and technique. Enjoy your workout!

Name: Lever Gripless Shrug
Description:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body.

2. Keep your arms straight and let the dumbbells hang naturally in front of your thighs.

3. Lift your shoulders as high as possible while keeping your arms straight, making sure to avoid any rotation or bending at the elbows.

4. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, squeezing your shoulder blades together.

5. Slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

Name: Lever High Row (plate loaded)
Target: Infraspinatus, Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Teres Minor , Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Sit down on the Lever High Row machine and adjust the seat height so that the handles are positioned just below your shoulders.

2. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and place your feet firmly on the footrests, ensuring a stable base.

3. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, pull the handles toward your chest by using your upper back muscles. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you do this movement.

4. Pause for a brief moment at the peak of the contraction, making sure to keep your elbows pointed out to the sides.

5. Slowly straighten your arms and return to the starting position, allowing your upper back muscles to stretch.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled and steady pace throughout the movement.

Remember to adjust the weight load according to your fitness level and always prioritize maintaining proper form and technique.

Name: Lever Kneeling Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Description:
1. Start by adjusting the leg pad of the lever kneeling leg curl machine to an appropriate position. Make sure it aligns with your lower leg, just above your ankles.

2. Position yourself facing the machine and kneel on the seat with your knees resting against the pad. Your feet should be pointing straight forward and your upper body should be upright.

3. Place your hands on the handles provided on either side of the seat for stability and support.

4. Begin the exercise by flexing your knees, pulling the lever towards your buttocks with your lower legs. Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the movement.

5. Pause briefly at the fully contracted position, squeezing your hamstrings. Ensure that your quadriceps are actively lengthening as your hamstrings contract.

6. Slowly return to the starting position by extending your lower legs, pushing the lever away until they are straight but not locked at the knee. This completes one repetition.

Remember to adjust the weight according to your fitness level and gradually increase it as you get stronger. Focus on maintaining proper form, controlling the movement, and feeling the contraction in your hamstrings throughout the exercise.

Name: Lever Lateral Raise
Description:
1. Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.

2. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles.

3. Begin the exercise by lifting your arms out to the sides, maintaining a slight bend in your elbows. Imagine you are pushing on a lever, hence the name "lever lateral raise."

4. Continue raising your arms until they reach shoulder level, making sure to keep your palms facing downwards throughout the movement.

5. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulder muscles, and then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.

Name: Lever Leg Extension
Description:
1. Sit on the lever leg extension machine with your back against the backrest and your feet flat on the footrest.

2. Adjust the top portion of the machine so that it rests against your thighs, just above your knees.

3. Grasp the side handles of the machine for stability and balance.

4. Slowly extend your legs by pushing against the footrest until your legs are fully extended.

5. Hold the extended position for a moment and then slowly flex your legs to return to the starting position.

Remember to always maintain a controlled motion throughout the exercise to avoid any jerking or quick movements.

Name: Lever Lying Leg Curl
Description:
1. Lie face down on the leg curl machine bench with your knees at the edge and your ankles secured under the padded lever.

2. Place your hands on the hand grips provided for stability and support.

3. Slowly curl your legs up towards your glutes by contracting your hamstring muscles. Make sure to keep your torso flat on the bench throughout the movement.

4. Pause momentarily at the top of the movement and squeeze your hamstrings.

5. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position while maintaining control and tension in the hamstrings.

6. Continue to repeat the exercise, focusing on the contraction and controlled movement of the leg curl.

Name: Lever Military Press (plate loaded)
Synergist: Deltoid Lateral, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Serratus Anterior, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Begin by sitting on the Lever Military Press machine and adjust the seat height and backrest position to ensure proper alignment with your body.

2. Place your feet flat on the floor and grasp the handles of the machine with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

3. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, exhale and push the handles upward by extending your arms fully. Pause for a brief moment at the top, making sure not to lock out your elbows.

4. In a controlled manner, lower the handles back down to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.

5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and utilizing your upper body strength to execute the movement effectively.

Name: Lever Neutral Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
Target: Infraspinatus, Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Teres Minor , Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Sit down on the seated row machine with your back straight and feet firmly planted on the footrests.

2. Grab the handles, or grips, with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).

3. Keep your elbows slightly bent and pull the handles towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.

4. Hold the contraction for a moment, feeling the tension in your back muscles.

5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position, keeping your back straight and controlled.

Remember to adjust the weight of the machine according to your comfort level and always maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

Name: Lever Overhand Triceps Dip
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Latissimus Dorsi, Levator Scapulae, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Begin by grasping the handles of the dip machine, making sure your palms are facing downwards.

2. Step forward, placing your feet on the platform in front of you, and straighten your arms to lift your body off the ground.

3. Keeping your torso upright and your elbows close to your body, slowly lower yourself down by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.

4. Pause for a moment at the bottom, and then push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows and using your triceps to lift your body.

5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring that your elbows remain slightly bent at the top to keep tension on the triceps throughout the exercise.

Name: Lever Preacher Curl
Description:
1. Sit down on a preacher curl bench and position yourself so that your armpits rest comfortably on the padding.

2. Grab the lever handles with an underhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.

3. Extend your arms fully and ensure that your elbows are locked in position.

4. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale as you curl the lever handles upwards towards your shoulders.

5. Pause for a brief moment at the top of the contraction, squeezing your biceps.

6. In a controlled manner, lower the lever handles back to the starting position without letting your elbows move forward.

Name: Lever Seated Calf Raise (plate loaded)
Description:
1. Sit on the seated calf raise machine with your upper legs secured under the leg pad and your feet resting on the padded foot platform.

2. Adjust the weighted plates to an appropriate starting weight for your fitness level and desired intensity.

3. Place the balls of your feet on the edge of the foot platform, allowing your heels to hang off.

4. Grasp the handles on either side of the seat for support and stability.

5. Slowly raise your heels by extending your ankles, pushing against the resistance of the weighted plates.

6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, feeling a contraction in your calf muscles.

7. Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position, allowing your calves to stretch and elongate.

8. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control throughout the exercise.

Name: Lever Seated Crunch (chest pad)
Description:
1. Adjust the chest pad: Start by positioning yourself on the lever seated crunch machine and adjust the chest pad to a comfortable height. Make sure the pad is resting against your chest just below your collarbone.

2. Position your feet: Place your feet on the footrest or platform, ensuring that they are secure and stable. Keep your knees bent at a 90-degree angle and maintain a neutral spine.

3. Engage your abdominal muscles: Slowly lean back while keeping your upper body straight and chest lifted. As you lean back, contract your abdominal muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.

4. Perform the crunch: Once you are in a comfortable position, initiate the movement by flexing your abdominals and bringing your upper body forward towards your thighs. Keep your chest out and avoid rounding your shoulders. Focus on using your abdominal muscles to control the movement.

5. Slowly return to the starting position: Exhale as you complete the crunch and slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position. Maintain control throughout the movement and do not let your body drop or collapse.

6. Repeat the movement: To complete the exercise, continue performing the crunches for the desired number of repetitions specified by your workout plan or instructor. Maintain proper form and engage your core muscles throughout the entire exercise.

Name: Lever Seated Fly
Synergist: Biceps Brachii, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Serratus Anterior
Description:
1. Start by sitting on the lever seated fly machine and adjusting the seat height and distance according to your comfort level.

2. Hold the handles of the machine with your palms facing each other and maintaining a slight bend in your elbows.

3. Keep your back straight and chest lifted as you engage your core muscles.

4. Inhale as you slowly push the handles forward, bringing them together in front of your body. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles during this movement.

5. Exhale as you slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control and keeping your chest muscles engaged throughout the exercise.

Remember to start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as your strength improves. Also, make sure to consult with a fitness professional or trainer to ensure proper form and technique.

Name: Lever Seated Hip Abduction
Description:
1. Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and place both feet on the footrests.

2. Adjust the machine so that your knees are at a 90-degree angle.

3. Engage your core and maintain a tall posture throughout the exercise.

4. Push against the footrests and slowly open your legs outwards, away from each other, while keeping your knees slightly bent.

5. Pause for a moment when you feel a stretch in your hip muscles.

6. Slowly return your legs back to the starting position, maintaining control and avoiding any jerky movements.

Remember to start with a weight that is suitable for your fitness level and gradually increase the resistance as you progress.

Name: Lever Seated Hip Adduction
Description:
1. As an AI language model, I can provide you with a description of the exercise 'Lever Seated Hip Adduction' in a few steps. Please note that it is important to consult with a fitness professional before attempting any new exercise.

2. Sit upright on the Lever Seated Hip Adduction machine with your back firmly against the backrest and your feet flat on the foot pedals.

3. Place your thighs against the padded thigh support, ensuring that your knees are in line with the machine's pivot point.

4. Grasp the handles on the sides of the machine for stability.

5. Slowly and controlled, press your thighs together while keeping your feet and knees in contact with the foot pedals and thigh support, respectively.

6. Pause for a second as your thighs are fully adducted (pressed together), feeling the contraction in your hip muscles.

7. Gradually release the tension and return to the starting position, allowing your thighs to open up once again.

Remember, when performing any exercise, it is essential to use proper form, start with a weight and resistance level suitable for your fitness level, and pay attention to your body's signals to avoid any injury.

Name: Lever Seated Leg Curl
Description:
1. Sit on the leg curl machine with your back against the seat, and adjust the chest pad so that it comfortably rests on your upper thighs.

2. Place your lower legs under the padded lever, positioning it just above your ankles. Your feet should be flexed.

3. Grasp the handles on both sides of the machine for stability, ensuring your body is in a seated position with your knees slightly bent.

4. Slowly extend your legs, pushing against the lever, while exhaling. Keep your upper body stationary throughout the movement.

5. Hold the fully extended position for a moment, focusing on contracting your hamstrings.

6. Inhale as you slowly contract your hamstrings to flex your knees and bring your lower legs back towards your upper thighs, returning to the starting position.

Repeat these steps for the desired number of repetitions.

Name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly
Synergist: Deltoid Lateral, Infraspinatus, Teres Minor, Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Description:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with your feet flat on the floor, maintaining an upright posture.

2. Hold a pair of dumbbells in each hand with an overhand grip (palms facing downward) and let your arms hang straight down, parallel to your body.

3. Keeping your elbows slightly bent, exhale and slowly raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor. Your shoulder blades should squeeze together during this movement.

4. Pause at the top of the movement, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, maintaining control.

5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on engaging your back muscles and maintaining proper form throughout.

Name: Lever Shrug (plate loaded)
Description:
1. Stand in front of the lever shrug machine, ensuring that the plates are loaded onto the lever arm.

2. Step forward and grasp the handles with an overhand grip, making sure your hands are slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

3. Keeping your legs slightly bent, straighten your torso and lift the loaded lever arm by extending your hips and knees. This will bring the weight up to a starting position just above your knees.

4. Once the weight is lifted, proceed to shrug your shoulders upward as high and as far back as possible, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.

5. Hold this position for a brief pause to maximize the contraction in your traps.

6. Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position and repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

Name: Lever Standing Calf Raise
Description:
1. Sit on the Lever Standing Calf Raise machine and adjust the seat height so that your knees are slightly bent and your feet are comfortably placed shoulder-width apart.

2. Place the balls of your feet on the foot platform, ensuring that your heels are hanging off the edge.

3. Grasp the handles on either side of the machine for support and stability.

4. Slowly lift your heels off the ground by extending your ankles and pushing through the balls of your feet.

5. Continue the upward movement until you feel a stretch in your calves, making sure to keep your legs straight throughout the exercise.

6. Hold the contraction at the top for a brief moment and then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.

(Note: Remember to adjust the weight according to your fitness level and gradually increase as you progress.)

Name: Lever T bar Row (plate loaded)
Target: Infraspinatus, Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Teres Minor , Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Begin by positioning yourself in front of the lever T bar row machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and your core engaged.

2. Grasp the handles of the lever T bar with an overhand grip, making sure your hands are shoulder-width apart.

3. Keeping your back straight and your chest lifted, exhale and pull the lever towards your upper abdomen, while simultaneously squeezing your shoulder blades together.

4. Pause for a brief moment at the top of the movement, focusing on contracting your back muscles.

5. Inhale as you slowly return the lever to the starting position, gradually extending your arms until they are fully extended.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, while maintaining proper form and control throughout the entire movement.

Remember to adjust the weight plates on the machine according to your comfort level and gradually increase the resistance as you become stronger.

Name: Lever Triceps Extension
Description:
1. Start by sitting on a bench facing away from the lever machine. Adjust the seat height so that the lever is at shoulder level.

2. Grasp the handles of the lever machine with an overhand grip, making sure your palms are facing downward. Your upper arms should be parallel to the floor and your elbows should be bent.

3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and extend your forearms by straightening your elbows. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement. Hold this position briefly, emphasizing the contraction.

4. Inhale and slowly lower the lever back to the starting position, allowing your elbows to bend and your forearms to return to the initial position. Avoid locking your elbows as you return to the starting point.

5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and control throughout the exercise.

Note: It is important to consult with a fitness professional or trainer before starting any new exercise program to ensure proper technique and to determine if the exercise is appropriate for your individual fitness level.

Name: Lying Leg Raise Flat Bench
Synergist: Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus, Gluteus Maximus, Pectineous, Quadriceps, Sartorius
Description:
1. Lie flat on your back on a bench, ensuring that your lower back is pressed against the bench and your legs are fully extended.

2. Place your hands by your sides, palms facing down, for stability.

3. Slowly lift your legs off the bench, while keeping them straight and extended.

4. Continue to lift your legs until they are perpendicular to the ground, or as close as you can comfortably reach without straining your lower back.

5. Hold the raised position for a brief pause, engaging your abdominal muscles.

6. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position, maintaining control and using your abdominal muscles to resist gravity.

Name: Pull-In (on stability ball)
Synergist: Obliques, Pectineous, Sartorius, Tensor Fasciae Latae
Description:
1. Begin by placing a stability ball at your feet and assume a push-up position with your hands on the floor directly below your shoulders.

2. Engage your core and bring your knees in towards your chest, rolling the stability ball towards your hands.

3. Maintain control as you extend your legs back out to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your body in a straight line.

4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on keeping your core tight and maintaining proper form throughout the movement.

Name: Pull up (neutral grip)
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Teres Major, Trapezius Lower Fibers
Description:
1. Start by standing directly under a horizontal bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.

2. Reach up and grip the bar with your palms facing each other in a neutral grip.

3. Engage your core and start by pulling your shoulder blades down and back.

4. Begin the movement by bending your elbows and pulling your body up towards the bar, while keeping your chest lifted and gaze forward.

5. Continue pulling until your chin is slightly above the bar or as far as you can comfortably go.

6. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the entire movement.

Name: Pull-up
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Infraspinatus, Teres Major, Teres Minor, Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Description:
1. Step 1: Stand in front of a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

2. Step 2: Jump up or use a stool to reach the bar and grab it with both hands, keeping your arms fully extended.

3. Step 3: Engage your core and start pulling your body upward by bending your elbows, keeping your shoulders down and back.

4. Step 4: Continue to pull until your chin reaches above the bar, making sure to maintain a straight line from your head to your feet throughout the movement.

5. Step 5: Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position, fully extending your arms and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Remember to start with a comfortable number of repetitions and gradually increase as you build strength. Keep practicing and you'll get stronger over time. Good luck with your pull-ups!

Name: Push-up
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Lie facing the ground, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

2. Keep your body straight and core engaged, raise yourself up onto your hands and toes.

3. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, while keeping your back and legs straight.

4. Continue lowering until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle or slightly below.

5. Push yourself back up to the starting position by fully extending your arms and returning to the initial position.

6. Repeat the exercise according to your workout plan.

Name: Rear Decline Bridge
Description:
1. Lie down flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.

2. Lift your hips off the ground, pressing your heels into the floor and squeezing your glutes.

3. Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

4. Lift your hips back up again, this time extending one leg straight out in front of you.

5. Keep your hips lifted and leg extended for a few seconds, engaging your core and glutes.

6. Slowly lower your leg back down and repeat the exercise with the other leg extended.

Name: Rear Pull-up
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head, Teres Major, Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Description:
1. Start by standing in front of a bar or sturdy horizontal surface that is high enough for you to hang from.

2. Reach your arms up and grab the bar using an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.

3. Engage your core and squeeze your shoulder blades together as you begin to pull your body upwards.

4. Continue pulling yourself upwards until your chin is above the bar, making sure to keep your elbows close to your body.

5. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, maintaining control and avoid swinging.

Name: Reverse Dip
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Start by sitting on the edge of a sturdy chair or bench, ensuring that your hands are placed just outside your hips.

2. Plant your feet firmly on the ground in front of you, keeping your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.

3. Slowly lift your body off the chair by pushing through your hands, straightening your arms completely. Keep your back straight throughout the movement.

4. Lower your body back down towards the chair by bending your arms, allowing your elbows to point slightly backward. Aim to get your upper arms parallel to the ground.

5. Once you have lowered yourself as far as comfortable, push through your hands again to lift your body back up to the starting position.
 
Remember to maintain control throughout the exercise, focusing on engaging your triceps and core muscles. Avoid using momentum to perform the movement, and breathe steadily throughout.

Name: Reverse grip machine lat pulldown
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Teres Major, Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Description:
1. Sit on the lat pulldown machine with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.

2. Grip the handles with your palms facing upwards in a reverse (underhand) position.

3. Lean back slightly and ensure that your arms are fully extended and shoulders are relaxed.

4. Slowly begin to pull the handles down towards your chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together.

5. Pause for a moment when the handles are close to your chest, feeling the contraction in your back muscles.

6. Slowly release the handles back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms once again.

Name: Seated Leg Raise
Description:
1. Sit on a sturdy chair with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.

2. Place your hands on the sides of the chair for support.

3. Slowly straighten one leg out in front of you, keeping your foot flexed and your toes pointing towards the ceiling.

4. Lift your leg as high as you comfortably can while keeping it straight, but be careful not to lock your knee.

5. Hold the raised position for a few seconds, feeling the contraction in your thigh muscles.

6. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position, and then repeat the exercise with your other leg.

Name: Side Plank
Description:
1. Lie on your side with your legs extended and stacked on top of each other. Position yourself on your forearm, with your elbow directly beneath your shoulder.

2. Lift your hips off the ground, forming a straight line from your head to your feet. Engage your core muscles and keep your body stable.

3. Maintain this position, ensuring your body doesn't sag or rotate. Focus on keeping your spine aligned and your abs engaged.

4. Hold the side plank for the specified duration or until you feel fatigued. Breathe steadily throughout the exercise.

5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the ground, returning to the starting position.

Remember to switch sides and perform the exercise on the opposite side to balance the muscles worked.

Name: Sit-Up (version 2)
Synergist: Obliques, Pectineous, Quadriceps, Sartorius, Tensor Fasciae Latae
Description:
1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart.

2. Place your hands behind your ears or cross them over your chest. Keep your elbows out to the sides.

3. Engage your core by drawing your belly button in towards your spine.

4. Slowly lift your upper body off the ground by engaging your abdominal muscles. Focus on using your core to initiate the movement rather than relying on your neck or arms.

5. Continue to lift until your shoulder blades are off the ground, and then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.

Name: Sled Forward Angled Calf Raise
Description:
1. Begin by standing in front of a sled weight machine, with the balls of your feet positioned on the foot platform.

2. Ensure that your feet are angled forward slightly, with your toes pointing straight ahead.

3. While maintaining a strong core and straight back, push your body upward through your toes, extending your ankles and lifting the sled forward.

4. Rise as high as you can onto the balls of your feet, fully engaging your calf muscles.

5. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, allowing your heels to drop below the foot platform.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on a controlled and smooth motion throughout.

Remember to adjust the sled weight according to your fitness level and gradually increase the resistance as you become stronger. Keep proper form and don't rush through the movement to maximize the effectiveness of the exercise.

Name: Sled Hack Squat
Description:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart on a sled positioned behind you.

2. Bend your knees and reach down to grip the handles on either side of the sled. Ensure that your back is straight and your chest is lifted.

3. Slowly push the sled away from you by extending your legs and straightening your knees. Keep your core engaged and your upper body stable throughout the movement.

4. Continue to push the sled until your legs are almost fully extended but still maintain a slight bend in your knees.

5. Once you've reached the desired position, slowly bend your knees again and lower the sled back towards you while maintaining control of the movement.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions or as instructed by your trainer.

Remember to always use proper form and start with a lighter weight before progressing to heavier loads. Happy sled hack squatting!

Name: Sled Lying Squat
Description:
1. Begin by lying down on your back on a flat surface with your knees bent and your feet resting on top of a sled.

2. Gripping the handles on the sides of the sled, exhale and press your feet firmly into the sled to extend your legs, keeping them parallel to the ground.

3. Inhale as you slowly bend your knees, lowering the sled towards your butt, maintaining control and ensuring your lower back stays flat on the ground.

4. Once your knees reach a 90-degree angle, pause briefly, then exhale and push the sled away from your body, extending your legs and returning to the starting position.

5. Repeat this squatting motion for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on engaging your leg muscles and maintaining proper form throughout the exercise.

Please note that it's always important to consult with a fitness professional or trainer before attempting any new exercise to ensure it is appropriate for your specific fitness level and goals.

Name: Smith Behind Neck Press
Synergist: Deltoid Lateral, Serratus Anterior, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, and position yourself under a Smith machine with the barbell resting on the back of your shoulders.

2. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Ensure your elbows are pointing straight ahead.

3. Brace your core, engage your glutes, and keep your chest up. Take a deep breath in.

4. Exhale and push the barbell directly upward, extending your arms fully while keeping your elbows slightly bent. Avoid shrugging your shoulders or moving your lower body.

5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then inhale as you slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, maintaining control and preventing it from resting on your neck.

Remember to start with lighter weights and gradually increase them as you become comfortable with the exercise. If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop immediately and consult a professional.

Name: Smith Bench Press
Target: Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Set up the Smith machine: Adjust the barbell to a suitable height. Lie down on the bench positioned directly under the bar, ensuring your feet are planted firmly on the ground.

2. Grip the bar: Reach up, grasp the bar with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Your hands should be directly above your shoulders with your palms facing forward.

3. Unrack the bar: Using your chest muscles, push the bar up and away from the rack. Hold it steady directly above your chest.

4. Lower the bar: Slowly lower the bar toward your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your upper arms parallel to the ground. Aim to lower the bar until it touches your chest or comes close to it.

5. Push the bar up: Engage your chest muscles, push through your hands, and extend your arms to lift the barbell back up to the starting position. Fully extend your arms, but avoid locking out your elbows.

6. Repeat: Complete the desired number of repetitions by repeating steps 4 and

7. Remember, proper form is crucial to avoid injury. Maintain control throughout the movement, breathe consistently, and ensure your back, shoulders, and feet are properly positioned.

Name: Smith Chair Squat
Description:
1. Start by standing in front of the Smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. The bar should be resting on the back of your shoulders.

2. Engage your core muscles and keep your back straight as you begin to slowly lower your body down into a squatting position. Imagine that you are sitting back into an imaginary chair.

3. Continue to lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Make sure that your knees are not going past your toes and your heels are firmly planted on the ground.

4. Pause for a brief moment and then push through your heels to return to the starting position, making sure to keep your core engaged and back straight throughout the movement.

Name: Smith Close-Grip Bench Press
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Begin by setting up the Smith machine to a height that allows you to comfortably sit and reach the bar overhead while your feet are planted on the ground.

2. Sit on the bench beneath the Smith machine bar, making sure your feet are firmly planted on the floor and your back is in a neutral position.

3. While keeping your grip close, reach up and grasp the bar with your hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.

4. Lower the barbell down towards your chest by bending your elbows. Make sure to keep your upper arms close to your sides during this motion.

5. Once the barbell touches your chest, pause briefly, and then push the weight back up using your chest and triceps muscles, until your arms are straight, but not locked.

6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control and proper form throughout the movement.

Remember to always warm up properly before starting any exercise, and consult with a fitness professional if you are unsure about performing this exercise correctly.

Name: Smith Deadlift
Description:
1. Position yourself in front of the Smith machine with your feet hip-width apart. Place your shins close to the barbell, ensuring it is aligned with the middle of your feet.

2. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

3. Keep your back straight and engage your core. This is your starting position.

4. Exhale as you push through your heels, extending your hips and knees to lift the barbell. Keep your back straight and maintain a strong grip on the bar.

5. Once you have fully extended your hips and knees, pause for a moment at the top of the movement, ensuring your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels.

6. Inhale as you slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, bending your knees and hips. Keep your back straight and control the descent of the barbell.

7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form throughout.

Name: Smith Decline Bench Press
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Adjust the Smith machine: Set the bench to a decline position of around 30 to 45 degrees, depending on your preference. Make sure the bar is at a comfortable height and securely locked in the Smith machine.

2. Position yourself correctly: Sit on the decline bench with your feet anchored firmly on the footrests. Lie back and keep your body flat against the bench. Your head should be positioned slightly lower than your feet.

3. Grip the bar: Reach up and grasp the bar with a shoulder-width grip. Your palms should be facing forward, away from your body. Make sure your grip is firm and secure.

4. Lower the bar: With controlled movement, slowly lower the bar towards your lower chest, maintaining control throughout the descent. Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body.

5. Press the bar upward: Push the bar back up to the starting position by extending your arms and fully contracting your chest muscles. Exhale during this part of the exercise.

6. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions according to your workout plan, ensuring proper form and technique.

Remember to start with a weight that you are comfortable with and gradually increase as you progress. If you have any further questions or concerns about your form, feel free to consult a fitness instructor or a professional trainer for guidance. Enjoy your workout and stay safe!

Name: Smith Decline Reverse-grip Press
Synergist: Deltoid Anterior, Pectoralis Major Clavicular Head, Triceps Brachii
Description:
1. Adjust the Smith machine to a decline angle of your preference.

2. Lie down on the bench facing up, with your feet secured under the leg brace.

3. Grasp the barbell with an underhand (reverse) grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

4. Extend your arms and push the barbell upward until your arms are fully extended but not locked. This is your starting position.

5. Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in and your upper arms at a 45-degree angle to your body.

6. Pause for a moment once the barbell touches your chest, and then reverse the motion by pushing the barbell back up to the starting position.

As you execute the Smith Decline Reverse-grip Press, remember to maintain a controlled and steady movement, focusing on proper form throughout the exercise.

Name: Smith Incline Bench Press
Description:
1. Start by adjusting the height of the bar on the Smith machine so that it is positioned slightly above your chest level when lying down on the incline bench.

2. Position yourself on the incline bench, ensuring that your back and head are fully supported. Your feet should be flat on the floor or braced against the footrest for stability.

3. Reach up and grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Make sure your palms are facing forward and your wrists are aligned with your forearms.

4. Take a deep breath, brace your core, and unrack the bar by extending your arms fully. Lower the bar slowly towards your upper chest while keeping your elbows slightly tucked in.

5. As you lower the bar, inhale and touch it lightly to your chest without bouncing. Maintain control and avoid any excessive motion or arching of your back.

6. Exhale and push the bar back up to the starting position by extending your arms fully. Lockout your elbows without locking them out completely and repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.

Remember to always execute exercises like the Smith Incline Bench Press with proper form and technique to maximize safety and effectiveness.

Name: Smith Incline Reverse-grip Press
Description:
1. Start by positioning yourself on an incline bench with your chest against the backrest, facing upwards.

2. Extend your arms fully and grab the bar of the Smith machine using a reverse grip (palms facing towards you) at a comfortable distance apart.

3. Keep your feet firmly planted on the ground and engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine.

4. Slowly lower the bar towards your upper chest by bending your elbows, while keeping your upper arms close to your body. Aim to bring the bar just above your nipple line.

5. Pause for a moment when the bar is at the bottom position, and then exhale as you press the bar back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully.

6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form and control throughout.

Note: It is important to ensure that the weight on the Smith machine is appropriate for your strength level and progressively increase it as you become more comfortable with the exercise. Additionally, always warm up properly before performing any exercise and consult with a fitness professional if you have any concerns or questions about proper technique.

Name: Smith Leg Press
Description:
1. Adjust the height and weight of the Smith machine to your desired level.

2. Position yourself on the leg press machine, ensuring your back is flat against the pad and your feet are shoulder-width apart on the footplate.

3. Bend your legs and lower the footplate towards your body as far as comfortably possible, keeping your heels planted firmly on the footplate. Avoid any jerking or rapid movements during this phase.

4. Push through your heels and extend your legs until they are almost fully straightened, but make sure not to lock your knees.

5. Pause briefly in this extended position, then slowly bend your legs to return to the starting position. Keep your movements controlled and avoid allowing the weight to drop abruptly.

Note: It is important to consult a qualified fitness professional or trainer before attempting any new exercise to ensure proper form and technique, as well as to determine the appropriate weight and intensity for your individual fitness level.

Name: Smith Bent Over Narrow Supinated Grip Row
Target: Infraspinatus, Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Teres Minor , Trapezius Lower Fibers, Trapezius Middle Fibers
Synergist: Brachialis, Brachioradialis, Deltoid Posterior, Pectoralis Major Sternal Head
Description:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.

2. Bend forward from your hips, keeping your back straight and your torso parallel to the ground.
